image.altText: A woman holds a framed photo of another woman.

props.synopsis: Chrystalle had a history of self-harm and was diagnosed with borderline personality disorder. One day she presented to the local hospital but was left alone for too long.

title.children: Chrystalle asked her local hospital to keep her alive. She was offered tea and left alone to die

image.altText: A bearded man in a baseball cap

props.synopsis: AFL footballer Marlion Pickett is likely to plead not guilty to multiple charges including burglary and criminal damage, his lawyer says.

title.children: AFL player Marlion Pickett likely to plead not guilty to charges of burglary

image.altText: The rear of a boat made out of beer cans.

props.synopsis: Carefully crafted from the Wheatbelt's sturdiest tinnies, the SS Wyalkatchem is set to fly the flag for WA in the annual Darwin beer can regatta.

title.children: Boat made from 8,000 beer cans all set for 3,700km journey to Australia's Top End

image.altText: An elderly man in glasses and a cowboy hat stands in front of a rusted red background.

props.synopsis: Where Trump's unfinished wall ends on Jim's ranch you can simply walk across the border into Mexico. It's the centre of a political battle that will shape the US presidential election.

title.children: Mexican cartels smuggle drugs and people through gaps in Trump's border wall. Jim's had enough

image.altText: three men in army greens standing by an army vehicle

props.synopsis: Around 400 Australian Defence Force personnel have taken part in Operation Austral Shield, simulating an attack on the region by a theoretical enemy.

title.children: Troops on the ground for exercise in northern WA as calls grow for permanent military presence

image.altText: He walks past a tall gum tree and wears red sneakers, photo taken from low

props.synopsis: A new $800 million contract for WA's Royal Flying Doctor Service has come as "a slap in the face" to rural doctor Michael Livingston, who wants more money spent on primary health care in the bush.

title.children: Regional doctor questions WA government's massive funding boost for the RFDS

image.altText: Three pieces of gold bullion in Perth Mint covers.

props.synopsis: The man allegedly used Facebook Marketplace to sell fake gold bullion made from copper or gold-plated plastic, ACT police said.

title.children: Man accused of selling fake Perth Mint gold bullion over Facebook Marketplace in Canberra

image.altText: Donald Trump raises his fist while surrounded by secret service agents.

props.synopsis: Television is regularly declared to be dead, or at least dying. But nobody seems to have told American politics, where TV still wields a bafflingly disproportionate degree of power in what is supposed to be the greatest democracy on Earth.

title.children: We've reached a point where Hollywood actors are telling hard truths America's leaders would rather avoid

image.altText: A family of six sit in front of a tree.

props.synopsis: Mum-of-four Danielle Gould says every woman should have a choice where they wish to give birth and is calling for a midwifery-led family birthing centre in Bunbury.

title.children: Mum calls for family birth centre after St John of God maternity ward closes

image.altText: three people a climbing a sheer rock face on a mountain, holding on to the side

props.synopsis: A 27-year-old bushwalker missing in the Tasmanian wilderness has been found dead, police say.

title.children: Missing bushwalker's body found after it is believed he fell near Tasmania's Federation Peak

image.altText: The Eiffel Tower with the Olympic rings lit up in Paris

props.synopsis: Two Australian tech workers for Channel Nine have escaped serious injury after they were attacked in an attempted robbery in Paris on Monday.

title.children: Channel Nine Olympics staffers attacked in Paris as Australian police deployed

image.altText: The rescue helicopter landed at Royal Darwin Hospital behind a fence.

props.synopsis: An aircraft has crashed in a remote part of the NT during a multinational military exercise, in which the pilot was ejected from the plane.

title.children: Aircraft crashes in remote NT during multinational military exercise

image.altText: A composite picture of LeBron James, Katie Ledecky and Noah Lyles

props.synopsis: There are more than 10,000 of the world's best athletes competing at the Paris Olympics. Here's a very short list of who you should keep your eyes on when the action gets underway.

title.children: The biggest names and brightest stars to watch at the Paris Olympics

image.altText: A protester holds a placard reading 'stop killing students'

props.synopsis: Here's what has caused mass death, 2,500 arrests and a country of 171 million people to go without internet for almost a week.

title.children: Mass death, 2,500 arrests and almost 170 million offline: What you need to know about protests in Bangladesh

image.altText: Guards outside of the Windsor Castle

props.synopsis: King Charles, who has long been outspoken on conservation, made several green steps over the past year, including the installation of solar panels on part of the Windsor Castle estate.

title.children: Royals look to go green with solar panels installed at Windsor Castle and biofuel for the Bentleys

image.altText: IOC president Thomas Bach

props.synopsis: IOC president Thomas Bach announced a 12-year deal with Saudi Arabia which will see the country host the Esports Olympic Games starting in 2025.

title.children: 'Truly a new era': Saudi Arabia to host inaugural Esports Olympic Games in landmark IOC announcement

image.altText: Republican presidential nominee Trump holds a campaign rally with his running mate Vance for the first time, in Grand Rapids

props.synopsis: Since the end of the presidency of Barack Obama, who was 47 when he took his first oath of office, US politics has not only looked chaotic and unhinged, but tired and exhausted. American democracy has seemed more like an American gerontocracy.

title.children: Chaotic and unhinged, tired and exhausted: American politics has descended into old age

image.altText: A woman wearing navy blue jacket rests her chin on her hand

props.synopsis: Kimberly Cheatle has resigned from her position after admitting that the attempted assassination amounted to a failure of her mission to protect America's leaders.

title.children: US Secret Service director resigns after conceding agency failed to prevent assassination attempt on Donald Trump

image.altText: A composite image of Mark Kelly, Pete Buttigieg and Gretchen Whitmer  speaking on stages.

props.synopsis: With Kamala Harris the presumptive Democratic presidential nominee, the biggest question looming for the party is who could be her running mate. Here's a look at the names currently in contention to join her on the ticket.

title.children: Who could be Kamala Harris's running mate?

image.altText: A blonde boy in a blue hoodie looks on as a whale tips over a fishing boat.

props.synopsis: A video taken by 16-year-old Colin Yager shows the whale breaching, then flopping onto the rear of the boat as two men jump.

title.children: Video captures boaters being thrown into water as whale flips vessel

image.altText: A group of politicians in suits walk together.

props.synopsis: In a letter penned by South Australian Premier Peter Malinauskas, state and territory premiers warned they remained unsatisfied with planned changes to the National Disability Insurance Scheme, which they warned would "risk creating service gaps" if some responsibilities were shifted to the states.

title.children: State premiers pen letter to defy NDIS reforms that 'risk creating service gaps'

image.altText: The clasped feet of a ten-month-old baby boy on a blue rug.

props.synopsis: Economists are blaming cost of living pressures for plummeting birth rates, saying there's been a decline in baby numbers not seen since the 1970s.

title.children: Australia in midst of a baby recession, shows new analysis

image.altText: Compile photo of a hand holding a mobile phone with a phone tower image on it

props.synopsis: Telstra and Optus are offering free mobile phones to vulnerable Australians as they prepare to switch off the 3G network within weeks.

title.children: Australia’s telcos are giving away free phones and gift vouchers, in last-minute bid to shift customers off 3G

image.altText: A middle aged white man with grey hair and a leather hat standing in front of a large tree marked with a large yellow H

props.synopsis: A New South Wales government agency has racked up more than $1.1 million in penalties for more than a dozen instances of unlawful activity in fewer than five years, including seven criminal convictions.

title.children: 'Total rogue': The government agency racking up criminal convictions and more than $1m in penalties

image.altText: Police officers patrol in front of the Eiffel Tower.

props.synopsis: French police investigate claims a 25-year-old Australian woman was raped by five men in Paris, days before the city is set to host the Olympic Games.

title.children: Athletes warned not to wear uniform after alleged gang rape of Australian woman in Paris

image.altText: Matt Dawson looks up and passes the ball

props.synopsis: Australian Kookaburras player Matt Dawson decided losing the top of his ring finger just two weeks out from the Paris Olympics was a price worth paying to appear at the Games.

title.children: Kookaburras in 'shock' after hockey star removes finger to play at Paris Games

image.altText: A plastic inflatable castle

props.synopsis: The jumping castle at the centre of the Hillcrest school tragedy will be reinflated, after a Tasmanian coroner ruled the key piece of evidence could be released ahead of a pending criminal hearing.

title.children: Jumping castle involved in death of Tasmanian schoolkids to be reinflated ahead of hearing

image.altText: A large, yellow sun setting with a red sky.

props.synopsis: Preliminary data from the European Union's climate change service points to July 21 as the world's new hottest day since records began.

title.children: World sets new record for hottest day

image.altText: Candice Prosser sits on a pink chair wearing a pink top underneath a dark suit against a black background

props.synopsis: Being a woman of six-feet tall is, statistically speaking, extremely rare. ABC reporter Candice Prosser reflects on falling in the upper 99th percentile for height for an Australian woman and speaks to others using their stature to their advantage.

title.children: Being a six-foot woman is rare in Australia. Meet those using their stature to empower others

image.altText: The Australian passport in front of a night-mode world map

props.synopsis: The Henley Passport Index 2024 has again crowned Singapore the country with the world's most powerful passport. See where Australia sits on the list.

title.children: These are the world's most powerful passports in 2024. See where Australia sits

image.altText: ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: The Australian share market closed lower following Wall Street as investors digest the latest financial results from America's biggest companies, including Tesla's profit margin slump. Follow live.

title.children: CrowdStrike releases preliminary report into the BSOD — as it happened

image.altText: a mine site with a big truck and white rock

props.synopsis: After opening to much fanfare, Core Lithium has shut all operations at a Northern Territory mine and is cutting costs until it can get a higher price for its product.

title.children: Lithium miner goes from boom to bust in under two years but holds hope of revival

image.altText: A woman and man standing side by side with the US Capitol building in background, holding a poster saying KIDNAPPED

props.synopsis: As Benjamin Netanyahu arrives in Washington DC to meet with Joe Biden and address the US Congress, families of those kidnapped on October 7 are frustrated that the Israeli leader is wasting time, delaying a hostage deal to bring their loved ones home.

title.children: These American Israeli families lost loved ones on October 7. They say Netanyahu's US trip is a waste of time

image.altText: three donkeys stand out the front of an outback pub

props.synopsis: The Silverton donkeys are much-loved outback icons that spend their time roaming freely, and they are helping attract tourists to the small town.

title.children: Meet the outback donkey gang that plays 'chicken' with cars, lounges outside the pub and sasses tourists for food
